Steps to Reproduce:

VS code fails to do syntax highlighting on huge files (~100mb). In my case I tried to open log4j based log file. VS code didn't do syntax highlighting. Also it failed to toggle word-wrap on that file.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No - YES

data.title: Add CodeAction type to allow not automatically showing the lightbulb
data.body:
**Problem**
The TS extract method code action results in the quick fix light bulb being shown on almost every expression. This can be annyoing and also reveals that TS currently shows extract method in far more places than it probably should

I believe that VS does not automatically show the lightbulb for refactorings, only for quick fixes. With the current VS Code API,  there is now way for a `CodeActionProvider` to say if the lightbulb should be shown or not

**Fix**
This change adds a new `CodeAction` type with an additional `dontTriggerLightBulb` property. When a code action sets this property, the light bulb will not be automatically shown.

**Other possible API designs**
Another possible design would be to allow different `CodeActionProvider` to be provided for 'automatic' triggering (the current behavior), vs manually triggering (when the user presses ctrl+.). Such an API has the advantage of never computing manual code actions until they are actually needed. The downside is that `CodeActionProviders` would have to be polled during a UI operation in the manual case.

Fixes #33241

data.title: View | Toggle Minimap only works when an editor is open

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33301

Open an editor
Note the visibility state of minimap, either on or off
Close **all** editors
`View | Toggle Minimap`
Open an editor
Note that the visibility of the minimap has not changed
If you examine `settings.json`, you see that the value is not changed there either

This is the same behavior as the other "Toggle" commands in the menu group.

It makes me wonder, why are these all "Toggle"? Why aren't they check marks of on or off, like `File | AutoSave`.

data.title: Relative paths in 'markdown.styles' are not resolved correctly for markdown files in subfolders
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version
![VsCode About Box](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9137489/29844105-7053f22e-8d0e-11e7-8121-3aed1acda892.png)

- OS Version: Window 10 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a folder `Root`
2. Create a css file `Root\style.cs` with the following content
```css
h3 {
    color: red;
}
```
3. Create a md file `Root\index.md`
```markdown
###index
```
4. Copy the file into `Root\subfolder\index.md`
```markdown
###index
```
5. Create a custom vscode settings `Root\.vscode\settings.json` with the following content
```json
{
     "markdown.styles": [
         "style.css"
     ]
}
```
6. Open the `Root` folder with VsCode
7. Open the `Root\index.md` in the editor
8. Open the markdown preview tab
9. The preview load the style and display the correct result
![Correct Result](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9137489/29844607-2bb3b54e-8d10-11e7-8316-c89ac245e5f7.png)
10. Close all the editor tabs (including the markdown preview)
11. Open the `Root\subfolder\index.md` in the editor
12. Open the markdown preview tab
13. An error is shown because the path of the stylesheet is not resolved correctly:
![Css Load Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9137489/29844682-66d29d66-8d10-11e7-8116-0bf73deb01c5.png)
14. Copying the `Root\style.cs` in the `Root\subfolder\` produce the correct result.
![Copy Css In SubFolder](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9137489/29845157-23f6e428-8d12-11e7-8bfe-86711189f682.png)


From a cursory look at the commit history it seems that the problem originate from some recent change in the logic to resolve relative paths [introduced to support the multiroot feature](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/b62f3d41e18f27f26936203d5ccfca78aaadc52a#diff-34bb8650d91288dfeafb0956092c6b61). 
But i am not familiar enough with the codebase to be sure.


Thanks.

data.title: Automatic function/method folding

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please consider automatic function folding, based on the current cursor location.

I think it can be a great way to help developers maintain a high level mental map of source files and ease navigation between functions/methods. While it builds on existing building blocks already present in many code editors (block folding, tracking language specific scopes, ...) it may also be a novel approach (I'm not aware of any existing implementation)

The core idea is to edit source code with all functions folded by default, and expand the "current" function when the cursor enters it, then fold it back when the cursor leaves the function region. Explicit pins can allow developers to keep key functions expanded.

[Full description of the proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/13L_xmx64E-2Y8lHRX7wzJOXVteVMTApeUhcF4RSKU-w/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Proxy error on macOS Sierra
data.body:
Visual Studio Code show proxy error all the time.
I opened the Developer Tools to track the error (Help\Toggle Developer Tools)
All this tries I did with many different kind of proxy settings.

I have tried this different proxy address formats:
1.  No proxy configuration
2. "http.proxy": "http://ProxyIP:port"
3. "http.proxy": "https://ProxyIP:port"
4. "http.proxy": "http://user:password@ProxyIP:port"
5. "http.proxy": "https://user:password@ProxyIP:port"
6. "http.proxy": "http://domain\\user:password@ProxyIP:port"
7. "http.proxy": "https://domain\user:password@ProxyIP:port"
8. "http.proxy": "http://user@domain:password@ProxyIP:port"
9. "http.proxy": "https://user@domain:password@ProxyIP:port"

I tried with and without proxyAuthorization: "http.proxyAuthorization": "Basic" 
I tried with and without proxyStrictSSL: "http.proxyStrictSSL": false

All browsers are working: Safari, Chrome and Firefox
All terminal commands are working with http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables: curl, pod, gem, git, svn, etc...

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Verso 1.15.1 (1.15.1)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:

1 - When click "Code\Check for updates..." Show the error: 
Houve um problema de comunicao com o servidor de proxy da web seguro (HTTPS). Verifique seus ajustes de proxy. Para obter ajuda com este problema, entre em contato com o administrador do seu sistema. 

2 - When click "View\Extensions" IT LIST A LOT OF EXTENSIONS, but don't download the Icons showing this errors:
GET https://msjsdiag.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/msjsdiafor-chrome/3.2.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
GET https://davidanson.gallerycdn.vsassets.io/extensions/davidanson/vscode-markdownlint/0.10.0/1500614993551/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
GET https://davidanson.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/Davidkdownlint/0.10.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED

3 - If I select the "markdownlint 0.10.0" and click "Install", I got the error:
An unknown error occurred. Please consult the log for more details.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Using the proxy-tests, I tried many different kind of proxy formats with 2 different responses 

1 -
- http://ProxyIP:port or https://ProxyIP:port
- http://user:password@ProxyIP:port or https://user:password@ProxyIP:port
- http://user@domain:password@ProxyIP:port or https://user@domain:password@ProxyIP:port

| HTTPS XHR | 200 | 059911552e14ec17a6fa5cdd0bbf34c4c329b483 |
| HTTP Node | 0 | Timeout |

| HTTPS Electron | 200 | 059911552e14ec17a6fa5cdd0bbf34c4c329b483 |

2 -

data.title: "Go to File..." shows files in search.exclude
data.body:
"Go to File..." is essentially a search operation and should be be managed by `search.exclude`, or optionally an additional config, e.g. `goto.exclude`. Typical use-case is having Explorer reflect true contents of project (e.g. not hiding generated files), while other operations are for navigating files one will edit.

- VSCode Version: @latest
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Include `node_modules` in `search.exclude`, but not in `files.exclude` in settings
1. cmd + p
2. See excluded files appearing in results

![](http://i.imgur.com/VXf6lR1.png)

Confusing Hover/warning in settings (multi root)
data.body:
Windows
Testing #33277 

1. make a new folder `mkdir workit`
2. Add a folder setting to hide status bar (status bar hides as expected)
3. save as a work-space `work1`
4. Settings editor has a warning - but the status bar is still hidden
5. reload window has no additional impact

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1051190/29837644-9027629a-8cad-11e7-8529-018d985369ed.png)

Expected - no warning as the setting did work.  Or at least better warning text to explain that it is being overridden by the Workspace setting.
